Description: Fragment of wall of North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl. The paint on the exterior fired to red (2.5 YR 5/6). On the glazed interior, two zones are separated by a red band lined in white; below, an incised palmette and lotus frieze; above, incised lotus and probably bud frieze; added red and white on both florals. On the slipped exterior, wild goats (their hooves remain) and a dot rosette above a stopt leftward maeander band framed by glaze bands with added red bands lined in white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 25, no. 85 pl. 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.162)
